content.description: Starting off with a 3D technical crux, then follow a thin seam up to a small roof using the seam and an assortment of face holds then exit left and top out. Insecure climbing with great technically movement combined with small but good gear makes for a very rewarding lead.
content.protection: Standard rack with emphasis on small gear.
content.location: This route is around 100ft from the start of the cliff band

content.description: This area holds potential for some good but short TR and trad routes with an average route length of just under 40ft. The rock quality here is decent but can be chossy in certain obvious spots. As this wall is basically the back side of Qual Wall, it sees little sun throughout most of the day. Setting up TRs is easy for most of the routes with an abundance of trees and easy top access.
